primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of the 'disadvantaged' (Israel/Barrio) from imperial settlement/death to freedom/newness through the recurring 'beat' of God's subverting action.

subject.identificatie: God (The Other One / The Holy God)
tekstueel_bewijs: The horse and the rider he has thrown in the sea
The one who comes to save, redeem, transform
Impossible angles of reality possible and available
End of empire, end of death

zender.identificatie: The 'Core Theme' of God's Character (Steadfast Love)
tekstueel_bewijs: The steadfast love of the LORD never ceases

ontvanger.identificatie: The Disadvantaged / The Barrio / The Church
tekstueel_bewijs: He has helped his servant Israel
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify as the Receiver (the 'low and despised') rather than the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Midwives (Shiphrah, Puah), Miriam, and Jazz (as a practice)
tekstueel_bewijs: Two mothers in the barrio who feared God and defied Pharaoh
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Primary Subject; the human actors are 'helpers' who vibrate to His beat.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that becomes an indwelling 'beat' or 'rhythm'.

tekstueel_bewijs: Nameless Lord of Egypt who tries to stop the music
The anxious power of disorder and darkness
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but 'Chaos' and 'Death' which only God can throw into the sea.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church's response: moving from 'staleness' and 'pet projects' back to the 'beat' of the Gospel.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Daring dance of defiance and gratitude
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/response) is strictly a 'variation' on the primary program (God's rescue).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Faithfulness → Newness of Life → The Barrio

voorbeelden_god_subject: The LORD kills and brings to life
He has thrown into the sea
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Shiphrah and Puah took the new babies

voorbeelden: Church people must get past themselves
I only know three things about jazz
By my God I can leap over a wall
Weakness adequate in the face of deathly strength

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Power' (Pouvoir) enabling the 'Incompetent' (the runt, the weak) to dance. It is a sermon of endowment.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Pharaoh's control) through ~S2 (the Barrio's suffering) to S1 (Miriam's song), while warning against falling into ~S1 (Ecclesial staleness).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Other One' who subverts the 'Settlement' of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; S2 is described as a 'killing' and 'disaster'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Human action is always a 'variation' or 'response' to the 'Primal Theme' which is God's active deliverance.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Shame on us, church, for reducing the lyric of newness

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The song is testimony to the one who comes to save, redeem, transform
The sea is the residue of chaos, the anxious power of disorder

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (David, Hannah, Mary) are not models of virtue to imitate, but 'jazz artists' who heard the same beat of God's grace.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: They are witnesses to God's subversion of power.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'Easter laughter' rather than the burden of performance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The metaphor of 'Theme and Variation' perfectly integrates the primary (God's act) and secondary (man's response) programs.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'settled power' and 'the beat'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The horse and the rider he has thrown in the sea... defeat of the powers of chaos.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'beat' is an endowment of competence to the 'lead-footed'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'Imperial Settlement' and 'Death'—a totalizing system.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's subversion of human 'settlements'. Humans are actants of 'vibration' and 'response'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the essence of a grace-oriented sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching. Brueggemann avoids the trap of making the 'midwives' the heroes of their own story, keeping the 'Other One' as the Subject of the active verbs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'jazz' metaphor's persuasiveness, Greimas shows how the metaphor functions to keep God as the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of Exodus 1 to show how the text's 'grammar' functions for the contemporary hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'shame' mentioned at the end is not a new law, but a call to return to the 'Receiver' position.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Jazz' as a semiotic code for the movement of Grace.
